required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Metabolism and Disposition of [14C] Herombopag in Chinese Healthy Human Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Metabolism and Disposition of [14C] Herombopag in Chinese Healthy Human Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a single-center, open-label, single-dose design. It is planning to enroll six Chinese healthy adult male subjects. The metabolism and disposition of Herombopag, will be studied in these subjects after a single oral administration of a solution dose of [14C] Herombopag (5 mg, 100 uCi).

detailed_description.textblock:
The metabolism and disposition of Herombopag, will be studied in six healthy men after a single oral administration of a solution dose of [14C]eltrombopag (5 mg,100 uCi).
The sutdy will investigate total radioactivity pharmacokinetics in whole blood and plasma 、quantitatively analyze the the total radioactivity in the excreta、evaluate the predominant route of elimination and indentify the Metabolite profiles in plasma 、urine and faces.

primary_outcome.measure: Total radioactivity pharmacokinetics in whole blood and plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 1 hour before administration to 240 hours after administration
From 24 hour before administration to 336 hours after administration
primary_outcome.description: Excretion of radioactivity in human urine and feces

primary_outcome.measure: the concentration of Hetrombopag in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 1 hour before administration to 240 hours after administration
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)

primary_outcome.measure: individual metabolite profiles in plasma 、urine and faces
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hour before administration to 336 hours after administration
primary_outcome.description: Using quantitative High Performance Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectroscopic method to analyse individual percentage of metabolites.

primary_outcome.measure: mean metabolite profiles in plasma 、urine and faces
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hour before administration to 336 hours after administration
primary_outcome.description: Using quantitative High Performance Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectroscopic method to analyse mean percentage of metabolites.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Health male subjects, age between 18-45 years.
- BMI between 19 and 26 kg/m2 .
- Signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Abnormal results in physical examination、laboratory tests、X-ray、abdominal ultrasound、echocardiography have clinical significance.
- Abnormal platelet counts or platelet aggregation has clinical significance.
- Abnormal troponin examination has clinical significance.
- Abnormal ophthalmic examination has clinical significance.
- Hepatitis B surface antigen, hepatitis C antibody, syphilis antibody or HIV antibody is positive.
- Those who have a history of allergies to test drugs or similar drugs.
- Those who have undergone surgery within 6 months prior to the trial .
- Those who took any drug within 14 days before the test (including Chinese herbal medicine).
- Any drug that inhibits or induces liver drug metabolism within 30 days before the test.
- Subjects who have participated in other clinical trial within the 3 months prior to study entry.
- One or more non-pharmacological contraceptive measures cannot be used during the trial or it is planned to have birth within one year.

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Suzhou University

facility.name: The first affiliated hospital of Suzhou university
